ai_flow.ai_graph package¶

Submodules¶

ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph module¶

class ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph.AIGraph[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.graph.graph.Graph

The program defined by ai flow will be represented by AIGraph. AIGraph consists of AINode and edges. AIGraph contains two kinds of edges, the data edge(ai_flow.ai_graph.data_edge.DataEdge) between AINodes in a job and the control edge between(ai_flow.workflow.control_edge.ControlEdge) jobs

Parameters

  • name – the name of Node

  • properties – node properties

  • output_num – each node has outputs, this represents the number of outputs

add_channel(node_id: str, channel: ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel)[source]¶

Add a data edge to AIGraph. :param node_id: node_id of the data receiving node. :param channel: An output of the data sending node.

add_node(node: ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.AINode)[source]¶

Add an ai node(ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.AINode) to AIGraph.

get_node_by_id(node_id: str) → Optional[ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.AINode][source]¶

Return the node whose node_id field is node_id.

class ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph.AISubGraph(config: ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph.AIGraph

It consists of a set of ai nodes(ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.AINode), all ai nodes have the same job configuration(ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig)

Parameters

  • name – the name of Node

  • properties – node properties

  • output_num – each node has outputs, this represents the number of outputs

add_node(node: ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.AINode)[source]¶

Add an ai node(ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.AINode) to AIGraph.

ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph.add_ai_node_to_graph(node, inputs: Union[None, ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel, List[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel]])[source]¶
ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph.current_graph() → ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph.AIGraph[source]¶

Return the current AIGraph.

ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node module¶

class ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.AINode(processor: Optional[object] = None, name: Optional[str] = None, output_num: int = 1, config: Optional[ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig] = None, node_type: str = 'AINode', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.graph.node.Node

AINodes are part of the ai graph(ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_graph.AIGraph), and there are edges(ai_flow.ai_graph.data_edge.DataEdge) connected between AINodes

Parameters

  • processor – The user defined function. Users can implement their own logic. Different job types define different types of processors. The user needs to implement the corresponding processor according to the specific job type.

  • name – The name of the AINode.

  • output_num – The output number of the AINode.

  • config – The job config(ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig) of the AINode.

  • node_type – User-defined node type.

  • kwargs – User-defined variable parameters.

get_processor() → object[source]¶
name()[source]¶
node_type()[source]¶
outputs() → List[ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel][source]¶

Return: The outputs(ai_flow.graph.channel.Channel) of the node.

class ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.ReadDatasetNode(dataset: ai_flow.meta.dataset_meta.DatasetMeta, processor: Optional[object] = None, name: Optional[str] = None, config: Optional[ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig] = None, node_type: str = 'ReadDataNode', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.AINode

Represents the AINode that reads the dataset.

Parameters

  • dateset – Need to read dataset meta information.

  • processor – The user defined function. Users can implement their own logic.

  • name – The name of the ReadDatasetNode.

  • config – The job config(ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig) of the AINode.

  • node_type – User-defined node type.

  • kwargs – User-defined variable parameters.

dataset()[source]¶
class ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.WriteDatasetNode(dataset: ai_flow.meta.dataset_meta.DatasetMeta, processor: Optional[object] = None, name: Optional[str] = None, config: Optional[ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig] = None, node_type: str = 'WriteDataNode', **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.ai_graph.ai_node.AINode

Represents the AINode that write the dataset.

Parameters

  • dateset – Need to write dataset meta information.

  • processor – The user defined function. Users can implement their own logic.

  • name – The name of the WriteDatasetNode.

  • config – The job config(ai_flow.workflow.job_config.JobConfig) of the AINode.

  • node_type – User-defined node type.

  • kwargs – User-defined variable parameters.

ai_flow.ai_graph.data_edge module¶

class ai_flow.ai_graph.data_edge.DataEdge(source: str, destination: str, port: int = 0)[source]¶

Bases: ai_flow.graph.edge.Edge

Connect two AINodes in a job. Data flows from the source node to the destination node.

Parameters

  • source – node_id of the data sending node.

  • destination – node_id of the data receiving node.

  • port – The serial number of the data sending port.
